itemDescription: bishop of the Old Catholic Church

wikipedia_page.main:
Arnold Harris Mathew, self-styled de jure 4th Earl Landaff of Thomastown (7 August 1852–19 December 1919), was the founder and first bishop of the Old Roman Catholic Church in the United Kingdom and a noted author on ecclesiastical subjects.
Mathew had been both a Roman Catholic and an Anglican before becoming a bishop in the Union of Utrecht (UU). His early life is the subject of some interest from researchers as a result of his aristocratic connections and his father's connection with colonial India.
